column14: The airmail plane crash landed and burst into flames on a farm in fog and snow while attempting to make an emergency landing.
Crrashed moments after taking off from Port-Francqui.

While en route to Los Angeles, the pilot, flying a low altitude due to poor weather conditions tried to turn back. While in a left turn his left wing struck a hill, crashed and burned. Adverse weather conditions. The plane flew into a sudden squall which cause the pilot to lose control.
Ran into thunderstorms and crashed into the sea.

While preparing to land, the plane side slipped and dived into the ground from a height of 500 ft. and caught fire. As quickly as the bodies were removed, a hastily mustered crew of pilots and mechanics from Universal Airlinesand Central Airlines, began removing all evidence of the accident, savagely fighting off reporters and photographers as they worked.
While attempting to land the plane struck a building and fell into the Connecticut river.
While attempting to land in snow, the plane rose up, stalled and crashed. Fatigue of the upper front strut of the right tail which failed in flight, causing the spar to fail as well.
Crashed into power lines 150 feet above the ground in fog.
While flying in foggy conditions at night, the captain lowered his altitude, hit a wave and fiipped over.
Crashed into Boston Harbor after losing the rightengine on takeoff.
The flying boat landed in a storm in the open ocean due to engine failure. After three hours, the plane wascapsized by a large wave while under tow.
The aircraft exploded in the air at an altitude of 4,000 feet shortly after taking off. The plane was flying in an area of fog and thunderstorms.
The plane crashed about 10 miles from its destination. Possible buffeting or irregular ocillation of the horizontal stabilizer leading to separation of the left stabilizer.
Crashed when the pilot made a sharp turn to avoid a chimney and lost control of the aircraft.
The plane caught on file shortly after taking off from Croydon.
The air mail plane crashed in fogwhile attempting to land in fog.

The airship was on its inaugural flight from Cardington, England to Karachi, (Pakistan). During a storm on the first night, it suddenly nosedived, leveled briefly, then dived again crashing and burning. Preparations had been rushed for political reasons and there had been no full-speed test flight. In the wind and rain, the outer cover split open at the front so that the two forward gasbags ruptured simultaneously. Dropping ballast raised the nose, but only because there was also dynamic lift, which was promptly lost as speed was reduced, presumably to save the remaining gasbags.
Crashed into hill while attempting to land after running into a strong gust of wind..
The french postal plane crashed into mountains.
Fflying over the Darling Range, aircraft went out of control and dove into a hilly terrain,
NULL
Crashed into high ground in fog after losing an engine. The plane was named City of Washington.
After developing engine trouble the pilot tried to parachute out of the plane but the parachute got caught on the plane and the pilot was dragged to his death.

column5: Porto Alegre - Laguna - Rio de Janeiro
column14: Crashed into the sea.
Crashed into a mountainside at an altitude of 4,500feet during a snowstorm.
The lower right wing of the aircraft hit the mast ofa river boat and the plane flipped over on its back andcrashed onto a river bank. The aircraft was named Shanghai.
